channel.title: Brains r yummy
channel.description:
If the Taliban hasn’t scared you off booking that trip to Pakistan, the latest outbreak of a brain-eating amoeba might. The nightmarish organism with a funky moniker (Naegleria fowleri) enters the body through the nose — hitching a ride on dirty water — then travels up to the brain, where it rapidly destroys tissue, killing its host in about a week. Ten people in Karachi have succumbed to the grey matter-chomping microscopic monster since May. But it can get you at home, too; over the past 10 years, 32 Naegleria fowleri infections have been reported in the U.S. Worried? Look out for fever, nausea, vomiting, a stiff neck and headaches. [url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/277508/pinoyabroad/news/deadly-brain-eating-amoeba-resurfaces-in-pakistan-s-most-populous-city][Source][/url]
This is kinda scary lol

Is this the new Swine Flu?

i’ve had swine flu and trust me its not nice.

item.title: Brains r yummy
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

the elve age:

I heard about this happening in Georgia (USA). For those who don’t know, the amoeba is grown during the optimal time of growth and reproduction. That time is particularly during any long, hot seasons. They are usually found at the bottom of lakes and when the bottom is stirred up. The brain-eating amoeba is very rare and can be stopped if caught ahead of time.

Yes but the girl who caught it was cut severely by a zipline cable and had a huge gash in her leg.

In other news there was a girl who caught it just by putting her hand in her fish tank and she got a tiny scratch on one of the fake shell houses and she caught it.

Read full topic
